result.execSummary:
The defendant Ronald P Hayes was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: In the event probation is revoked, Defendant would be entitled to Good Time Credit and Huber Privileges.

miscConds.notes: Costs to be paid directly to the Waushara County Clerk of Court within 60 days or establish a payment plan.  Failure to pay may result in suspension of your driver's license, tax intercept, a civil judgment being entered against you, a warrant being issued for your arrest for contempt and/or the debt being turned over to a collection agency.

The defendant must maintain absolute sobriety, may not be present upon the premises of any bars, and is prohibited from possessing/ingesting any impairing substances that have not been prescribed by a physician.
Defendant to undergo an alcohol and other drug assessment and comply with any further counseling and/or treatment as deemed appropriate by the supervising agent.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

from the DE to the Court regarding probation

Case called @ 3:36 p.m. Defendant Ronald P Hayes in court with attorney John Miller Carroll. Atty Carroll appears telephonically. Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Motion for withdrawal filed by Atty Carroll. Statement by the DE. Statement by Atty Carroll. The court questions the defendant as to whether he wishes to have subsequent counsel. Statement by DA Blader. The court will permit Attorney Carroll to withdraw. The DE wishes to speak with the DA. Recess for the parties to talk. 

Case recalled @ 3:46 p.m. The defendant wishes to enter a plea. Defendant advised of right to counsel and expertise.  Voluntary waiver of counsel accepted by Court.  Defendant advised of minimum/maximum penalty.  Plea colloquy entertained.  Collateral consequences explained. Chapter 950 compliance addressed. Upon motion of the State the Court amends Ct 1 to Misdemeanor Possession of THC contrary to Wis Stat 961.41(3g)(e).  Plea: Ct 1 - Guilty.  Court accepts plea and enters JOC. Ct 2 - DRI. Court orders: 90 days WCJ - Huber, GT, 2 days CFTS - I/S - 1 year probation - Conditions: AODA and follow through, defendant must maintain absolute sobriety, may not be present upon the premises of any bars, and is prohibited from possessing/ingesting any impairing substances that have not been prescribed by a physician, Costs w/ 60 DTP or PP. Appeal rights given.
Motion hearing at 10-05-2015 03:30 pm
to Withdraw
State's Notice of Motion and Motion for the Admission of Other Acts Evidence
State's Amended Motion to Impeach with Prior Convictions

Case called @ 2:23 p.m. Defendant Ronald P Hayes in court with attorney John Miller Carroll.  Scott C. Blader appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Standard jury instructions and motion in limine filed by the State. Motion to Impeach with Prior Convictions filed by the State. The defendant stipulates to the prior conviction. The court accepts the stipulation as to the previous conviction. Statement by Atty Carroll - believes that because the conviction is 14 years old it is not relevant. The court finds that should the defendant testify the defendant shall answer in the affirmative that there was one prior conviction. Rejected offer stated on the record by DA Blader. Atty Carroll and DE state that they are rejecting the offer extended. DA Blader - requesting clarification as to whether or not the crime lab analyst would be needed to testify. The court understands that there is a stipulation as to the crime lab report submitted by the analyst. If there is a substance that was not tested by the analyst that would not be included in the stipulation. The court accepts the report submitted by the crime lab analyst as stipulated by the parties. 32 jurors to be summoned.

Final pre-trial at 09-09-2015 02:15 pm.
Jury trial at 10-15-2015 08:00 am.

Case Called @ 3:20 PM: Defendant Ronald P Hayes in court with attorney John Miller Carroll.  Scott C. Blader appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Counsel discuss nature of motion - issues at contest today.  Court understands that the 5th Amendment motion seeking suppression of statement for want of Miranda warnings is being withdrawn.  Atty Carroll confirms motion for the time being can be withdrawn, should case move forward to trial may be brought up again.  Court believes all matters should be addressed today if possible.  Argument by Atty Carroll as to challenge of the Search Warrant.  Argument by DA as to probable cause for the search and premises warrant.  To the extent a 4 Corners Challenge exists - Court declines to grant that motion.  Court finds that info articulated in warrant application supports the request for the warrant being assigned to the property including all outbuildings, etc. associated with the property.  Court finds the warrant establishes probable cause as to the search undertaken.  Ex No 1 marked - Photograph.  Entered and Received for the purposes of this hearing only.  Argument by Atty Carroll as to particularity clause.  Argument by DA - case law recited as to lawful search - premises warrant.  Court reviews case law.  Finds warrant was a premises warrant for the premises being search.  Application articulates what is clearly a warrant that authorizes search for the entire premises.  Court finds that the warrant also included the trailer depicted in Ex No 1 and authorizes search of same.  Warrant contemplates search of the camper.  Court finds camper was clearly appropriately searched.  Respectfully denies suppression motion on that basis.  Sequestration ordered by the Court.   Det. Nate Klapoetke sworn in for testimony  Direct Exam by DA.  Cross Exam by Atty Carroll.  Re Direct by DA.  Off Jess Netzler sworn in for testimony.  Direct Exam by DA.  Ex No 2 marked - Report authored by Off J. Netzler.  Entered and Received.  Cross Exam by Atty Carroll.  Re Direct by DA.  Argument by Atty Carroll.  The Court:  Unequivocally, Def was in custody at the time of interaction with Det. Klapoetke.  The Court:  Denies the suppression motion and finds that the State may use those statements as part of their case in chief at any trial of this matter.  Written notification provided to the Court and DA by week's end  as to stipulation regarding the analyst.  JT and FPT scheduled.  Impanel 23 in Box - 5 Strikes Each.  Jury trial scheduled for October 15, 2015 at 08:00 am.  Final pre-trial scheduled for September 9, 2015 at 02:15 pm.
